meanings.sent1: The onfall of the enemy caught us by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers prepared for the onfall of the opposing army.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the unexpected onfall of rain forced everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent4: The onfall of criticism from the media was relentless.
meanings.sent5: The sudden onfall of darkness enveloped the forest.

meanings.definition: To fall upon or attack suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The lion will onfall its prey when it least expects it.
meanings.sent2: The ninja silently onfalls the unsuspecting guard.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally onfalled my friend with a surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The storm onfalled the coastal town with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The detective onfalled the suspect with incriminating evidence.

meanings.sent1: The onfall of snow in April was quite unusual.
meanings.sent2: The onfall of laughter broke the tension in the room.
meanings.sent3: The onfall of a new student brought excitement to the class.
meanings.sent4: The onfall of good news lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The onfall of the meteor shower was a breathtaking sight.
